Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: crystalaziza
Reviews.Content: This being our 4th trip to Hawaii, we usually stayed at a different hotel, but thought we'd try something different. We loved the White Sands for these reasons,..........Great price.........super location for us.......rather than having to walk a little further than our previous hotel stays required. My son lived in the pool which was a lot bigger than we previously had at our other hotel stays. The front desk people I encountered, Christina, Christieanna, & Jason were extreamly helpful & quite nice & made sure everything was O.K. for us. Room was more than sufficient for my son & I. I will definatly stay here again when I go back to Hawaii. I guess I could not really find one thing wrong with this hotel if I were asked to. The only thing that I would say that would make it better, would be to offer a small breakfast.......coffee, juice, milk, toast, waffles...etc. Nothing big.........although I didn't mind the walk to McDonalds in the beautiful Hawaiian weather......Thank You White Sands.......

Reviews.Title: “AVERAGE IS NOT AVERAGE”
Reviews.Author: bapstar
Reviews.Content: When you are 3 blocks from Waikiki Beach and every hotel is your haven, amongst the crowds this little old fashion triple decker motel has a pool, hot tub, waterfalls and old palm trees hidden inside. The price is right. Clean but not pristine. Excellent laundry, and reception a joy. My room was made up everyday, and these are not big time linens, there is a bigtime beach out there, a kitchette, excellent shower, couch, and door out to hot tub. No matter how warm the mighty Pacific, you need warmth afterwards, and not riding a elevator 29 floors down corridors, here the joyful hot tub is 30 feet away.. And, comment on the hula video its on all the time, like a fish aquarium... oh, oh, Apple Store 2 blocks away!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for one night...”
Reviews.Author: Judy G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at the end of our trip. Pool and courtyard with plants, flowers and little waterfall were wonderful. Room was clean but extremely musty smelling with heavy odor of bleach. I had a headache all the next day after sleeping there. Rooms definitely need an overhaul. Blanket on my bed was faded and had a cigarette burn. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. I wish the owners would invest a bit in this very cute hotel. I wouldn't stay there again unless it was updated.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel, Location Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Cami Jo S
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived at White Sands Hotel in Waikiki. It is a very well kept property and the staff is so accommodating and friendly. The rooms are a nice size with a kitchen. Sitting on my deck while sipping coffee, looking over the pool with the pleasant sounds of a rain forest, was my favorite thing to do each morning. The plants, flowers, trees, waterfalls and lovely birds surrounding the pool and hot tub was a very peaceful way to end the day. You seemed to forget that you are right in the middle of the city Waikiki, but when you exit the property you are in the the perfect location to walk to anything in Waikiki. I definitely will be returning to White Sands and highly recommend this Quaint affordable Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: njTravelJunkie222
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the property one night and it was one of the dirtiest hotels I have ever stayed at. I chose it based on all the "wonderful" reviews here and it was nothing like I expected. This was the end of trip which started in Honolulu and I stayed at another property that was in the same price range BUT so much nicer. (See Waikiki Sand Villa) The hotel is older and everything had a worn look to it. That I can live with, BUT when there is grime in all the corners and surfaces than its just neglect. We kept our shoes on at all time, including in the shower. If it wasn’t for the fact that it was one night we would have left and gone somewhere else. We were “upgraded” to a pool view. That was a laugh – the “pool view” actually gave us a sliver of the pool if we looked hard left and wonderful view of the residential property next door. AND as a bonus it is a three story walk up and the stairs overlook the alley where they stored all sorts of stuff. The area was also a little questionable. I am use to a city environment and would not recommend the location for anyone who is not.

Reviews.Title: “Here's the BEST hotel in Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Harvey M
Reviews.Content: I repeatedly go back to White Sands Hotel because the staff is ALWAYS kind and helpful, and the rooms are sized well, with kitchens. The pool is always maintained and sits in the middle of a tropical wonderland. Flowers and trees are always groomed. There is a well maintained hot tub, and a beautiful waterfall for peace of mind. They have a laundry room. Ask the people at the front desk about where to go or what to eat and they always show aloha in helping you. The rooms are cleaned daily and fresh towels are always ready for you. I cannot explain how great the front desk people are. Christianne, Christina, Ron, Josh are always smiling and want to help every guest. You can easily walk to the beach, the International Market, grocery store, restaurants or any other entertainment. They provide various kitchen cookware along with dishes and microwave (remember theres a stove too). The small refrigerator is just the right size to hold you groceries. Do keep in mind and ask about the parking, because in Honolulu parking almost always costs. So don't be surprised when you have an additional charge if you request parking conveniently at the hotel. The only thing I hated about the hotel was leaving. I wanted to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: pujugua
Reviews.Content: The “White Sands” hotel is just in the middle of Waikiki although in a very quiet street. It is not the Hilton but the quality/price ratio is excellent. It is kind of singular as it is not the usual tall buildings all over Waikiki. It is only a three-story hotel and it is full of trees and plants and it also has a small Japanese garden. Add to this that people at the reception desk are friendly and helpful, we would like to thank specially Cristina for her help and kindness, and the conclusion is that “White Sands” hotel is a very good choice if you go to Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Su C
Reviews.Content: It's one of a kind to be with during our long time planned vacation in this state and we were absolutely amazed in return of our expectations are well over it.The staffs are all helpful especially Kristina Hunt at the front desk she is well deserved to be in her post with all her smiles that gives us more relax to stay I guess that's what they call Aloha Spirit, where I can spread the word to all my friends and families that if ever they will be planning to visit Hawaii I would definitely recommend them Waikiki white sands hotel and I believe they will be smiling back home happily, I guaranty you that. Our experience of stay here is so much appreciated thanks to the managers of this property to hire good people to work for them.The pool is right there, jacuzzi and we can even set a party by the pool when some friends came by for a small get together drinking beers but we know our limits so it was really a good one. There's no restaurant inside but that's not a problem at all just take a short walk and we can find everything , so much to talk about, I can't ask for more, well be back again... Thank you so much

Reviews.Title: “Great location and the price is a steal”
Reviews.Author: CindyWindy_12
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great surprise. Because I didn't anticipate staying in the hotel room very long during my vacation (just to sleep and shower) I decided to opt for a lower cost hotel. I thought for the price something would be severely out of order or that service would be lacking. We were pleasantly surprised. We had a nice sized, quiet room with all the amenities other hotels provide. We were greeted by nice employees. Christieann and Cristina were so nice and so was their supervisor Paul. The room we had faced Nohonani street which wasn't a great view but we had a balcony and we enjoyed a few quiet mornings out there. The location is perfect too. Near great restaurants and the beach. When I come back, I will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, location and service”
Reviews.Author: frontman1955
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed in Honolulu for a few days to visit friends before heading to one of the other islands for a week. Since we were only going to be on Oahu for three nights and didn't plan on spending much time at the hotel I didn't want to spend a lot. I've stayed in Honolulu many times, am very familiar with the area. I ended up choosing the White Sands because of the price, amenities and locations, mainly because it has a small kitchenette in the room. The first thing I noticed was the friendliness of the check-in staff, particularly Jason. The service was fast and efficient, and the friendliness was genuine, not forced or phony. Jason seemed to go out of his way to make us feel welcome. Pluses: the room was older but clean. the outdoor area is very nice, pool and hot tub well maintained. My wife enjoyed lounging by the pool with some wine while I went scuba diving. (Center Ring Diving, check them out!) They have free WiFi, which the more expensive hotels charge for. Another plus, the location is fantastic, just a few hundred yards away from the International Marketplace, and about a 5 minute walk to the beach at Waikiki. Really just a couple of negatives: first, at least in our room, the AC was a small, old and tired window unit. We were there during a particularly warm week and the AC had a really tough time keeping up with it. Another downer: this is an older, lower priced hotel and it showed in the beds. They were on the hard side, it's time for new ones. Note: They have their own parking lot, but it is small. Call to reserve a spot when you book a room. Otherwise, there is public parking nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for the location”
Reviews.Author: Stefano C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at 10 minutes (walking) from Waikiki beach. It is near the bus stop (Kuhio Ave/ Seaside Ave) to reach Honolulu downtown, and Diamond Head or other beaches like Sandy Beach or Hanauma Bay (Bus 22). The hotel should be renovated, but it is clean and the room I occupied was near the swimming pool (room 104a). There is also a Jacuzzi near the swimming pool. WiFi is free but it do not work fast in the room. You have to go outside near the convivial zone around the swimming pool. I used it from the room using a slower connection. Every days the towels were changed. Receptionists were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: mikactsuchida
Reviews.Content: Me and my mom decided to stay at the White Sands Hotel. This hotel was small but it was filled with helpful staff like Cristina Hunt. All of the staff here helped us through of where to go and they gave us directions. The White Sands Hotel is very convenient and it is very close to some places like Waikiki Beach, The International Market Place and more. Around the International Market Place you will see some exciting things at night. There will be performers, magicians and more! Me and my mom suggest you to stay at the White Sands Hotel because it is very convenient, and the staff here are very friendly and there's a swimming pool and jacuzzi here too!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, close to everything, staf realy helpful”
Reviews.Author: CaroleCalgary_Canada
Reviews.Content: The staff who were in (Paul, Christieann and Jason) were helpful, smiling,we were able to stay at the pool until the shuttle came, even if it was after check out. Did not have to ask they offer, great! They put our luggage in the luggage's room, when we had to go back to pick up something from our bags, they stay around smiling until we were done. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “White Sands Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: glentap
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the White Sands Hotel in Waikiki and found it an excellent choice. Paul, the manager, and the staff (including Ron, Christieann, Cristine, Jason, and Rogie) were very friendly and helpful. We need an accessible room and the White Sands was a great choice. My wife needed an ambulance late one night and the night staff were right on it. Everything turned out fine and the White Sands staff were very considerate and caring.

Reviews.Title: “White sands”
Reviews.Author: TMK102
Reviews.Content: As a resident of Oahu, my partner and I love taking "staycations" and we don't want to break the bank. White Sands is the perfect venue with its ample parking (a must for us on staycations) and its friendly staff, especially Paul. He has fabulous suggestions, and I thought I knew Waikiki, his ideas were creative. Check out the White Sands whether you are on a staycation or a vacation, its so relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “cant wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Austin A
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Waikiki & had a local friend suggest the white sands hotel in the heart of downtown Waikiki. the location is absolutely perfect if you enjoy the downtown scene & nightlife, & prefer to cut down on driving & cab rides. From the moment i checked in to the White Sands Hotel, i was impressed. They went out of their way to accommodate us & make us feel extremely welcome. every single member of the staff was extremely friendly & helpful, although i mostly dealt with the night staff. The night security, Ray, was very helpful when i got lost & needed assistance. who knows where i may have ended up... Christie Ann, Paul, Jason, & Ese were all very friendly & pleasant to interact with also! No matter how many times i needed towels, they were always happy to give them to me. One of the best parts of my stay was the price! I was amazed to find such a reasonably priced hotel so close to downtown Waikiki, or anywhere in Hawaii for that matter! The rooms were very clean, spacious, & comfortable. The kitchenette space was good sized, & the beds were very comfortable. Even though we were excited to go to Maui, i really didn't want to leave. I really felt @ home @ the White Sands Hotel, & i very much look forward to returning in the fall & i will certainly return. I definitely recommend this hotel, or any of their properties to anyone looking to stay in Waikiki, including the Ewa hotel, as i've also stayed there the visit previous.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, great service, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Munsey20
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 2 weeks traveling around Hawaii and this was easily our favourite hotel! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is central Waikiki (2 minute walk from the beach) the buses stop at the end of the road. Would highly recommend the hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not clean”
Reviews.Author: daydreamer95
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for a week whilst we were in Waikiki celebrating my Mum's birthday. We booked two rooms with kitchenettes, we had one room with a kitchenette and the other with a fridge and a microwave- the two rooms did not warrant the same price and were not as described, luckily the rooms were reasonably closeby so shared keys and used the one kitchen, although not ideal. I had emailed the hotel before our arrival and told them it was a special trip for my Mum's birthday and requested rooms closeby with a nice view if possible. The rooms overlooked the car park and flats opposite- not my idea of a great view but then apart from looking out over the swimming pool there wasn't a nice view. The rooms were comfortable to sleep in although noise was an issue at night as doors constantly slammed and we could hear the traffic at night. We were woken up most mornings by the rubbish collection which came really early at about 5am, I sleep very deeply and it even woke me up. Not my idea of sleeping in paradise! The housekeepers came daily but the room was not clean when we arrived and was never actually cleaned! Seriously, there were bits of food on the floor not just under the sofa and bed but all over. We even found a sandal down the back of the sofa and a sock just on the floor behind a chair. The bathroom floor was disgusting especially by the toilet and there were weird stains on the walls which was really disgusting. We never felt clean in the rooms and couldn't walk round barefoot. The only way we knew the cleaners had been in the room was because our rubbish had been emptied and taken even if it wasn't put in the bin (that means it wasn't rubbish!) The man at the front desk was always very miserable and didn't seem to want to help us but Christie Ann was really friendly, happy and always helpful. Aside from the location and the pool and hot tub facilities she really is the only other positive about this hotel. I would not stop someone from booking this hotel as it was reasonably priced and is in quite a good location but just so you know what you are getting. After spending a week in Maui in a similarly priced hotel which was amazing to come to this hotel was really quite a shock and we wished it had been the other way around but we weren't to know.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: jess g
Reviews.Content: White Sands is a great little hotel in the middle of Waikiki. All of the staff were super friendly and helpful with everything while we were there. The pool area is great, and it was very convenient to have a kitchenette in the room. A "budget friendly" hotel with better staff than a lot of pricier hotels that I have stayed at. Definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a convenient and reasonably priced place to stay in Waikiki!

Reviews.Title: “Will be joining the staff at the White Sands July 15th!”
Reviews.Author: maria c
Reviews.Content: I am so excited to be staying at the White Sands. I have read all the reviews and taken in the bad with the good. And the good seem rule! I love that everyone raves about the staff. It is so important to be able to have great communication and friendly faces. I look forward to meeting you all very soon! Maria and the clan!

Reviews.Title: “A very good budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ColorBlind
Reviews.Content: 9-11 June 2012. Upon Check- in we reieved a happy Aloha greeting by The Desk agent Christieanii. Nice pool in the back. Rooms clean , beds were nice to sleep in. A nice Hawaiian budget hotel to stay in. Located on a quite side street. We had no parking problem. Both of us enjoyed our weekend stay Because of the Hotel Staff and Their welcoming Hawaiin Spirit. Michael and Linda.

Reviews.Title: “good for the money,friendly staff,great location”
Reviews.Author: gidget b
Reviews.Content: let me start by saying this hotel was perfect. Pricing was good,the staff was pleasant and our room was even upgraded. The kitchen was awesome,the shower was hot and the room i must say was clean.My only issue is i was charged for parking our first night but didn't have a stall to park in.The security guard did manage to find me a parking on the street for the night but I still had to get up by 7 a.m. to feed the meter, not my idea of a vacation,and also the bed needs to be changed, I could feel the springs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gary H
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an amazing location, the pool area is top notch! They have a bbq for you to use to cook dinner if you choose. The room was a room... Shower, bed. Nice they had a microwave, frig, and coffee maker in the room. My only draw back was the room needed a little deep cleaning... dusting of the fixtures and picture frames.... I finally took a wash cloth and did it my self... but maybe I am too picky. I loved the staff and were always friendly and kind. I will be staying here on my vacations to Hawaii in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Gary S
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Hawaii and we weren't sure where to stay but found the White Sands and was impressed with the price. The rooms were dated but very clean except the carpets could be replaced.The location was great being so close to everything and a nice little oais in the middle of it all. The staff Paul-manager ,Christieann M,Cristina H, Christina B,Rogie C, and Ron G were helpful,curtious, and so pleasant. Our last day there while waiting for the shuttle to the airport we met Craig Matsuura area director of facilities and had a great visit with this charming man who told us his wife had a health issue and we sincerely hope things are improving everyday and she is doing well. God Bless both of them. Sincerely Gary/ Pam Spurrell Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Clean basic hotel good for the value really nice staff personnel”
Reviews.Author: MBranche
Reviews.Content: For the price of under $100 with tax you get a clean basic room, with a good bed, fridge and coffeemaker, swimming pool and whirlpool. Hotel could use some updates. All rooms have a lanai, not necessarily over looking the pool. Road noise is not bad, close to Kuhio and about five blocks from beach access if you walk thru international market place along Duke Lane . Staff is extremely helpful and will store your bags after check out.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel- Clean & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Earlette S
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit, and to my surprise it was the perfect accomodations for a basketball team. The staff was outstanding, it fit our budget, very clean and a good location. Mahalo to Front Desk Christieann, Manager Paul and Housekeeping very efficient and friendly... Very Ohana.... We are returning in July 2012. Upcountry Kings Basketball Team, Maui

Reviews.Title: “Best price in Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: MicheleG808
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the staff was great! There were locals and vistors there and will be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended !”
Reviews.Author: vmax12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. For the price,nothing to say:the room was clean,the service excellent and the persons at the front desk ( Christieann and Paul) were very friendly and helped us a lot for every questions we had. Francine,Judth,Daniel and Bruno,from Sherbrooke Quebec Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for an excellent price!”
Reviews.Author: sarawoertink
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I had very low expectations when I first booked my stay. I went with the best price I could find and figured it would be a run down place, but I was wrong! At check in, Ron was extremely helpful and friendly. He seemed interested in what we had going on and wanted to help. I was surprised by how spacious our room was. We ended up hanging in our room much more than we anticipated because we could relax, have some drinks, and enjoy getting ready for the busy day. Our balcony over looked trees and the hot tub, which was nice. I loved having the kitchen in the room. We made breakfast every morning, which saved us some money. It is so close to shopping, bars/clubs, and the beach! It is definitely in a party area, so if you're looking for a secluded, romantic get away, you may want to look elsewhere. You can definitely still have a romantic time, but the area was best for those wanting to get out and go! The only downside was parking, but that is with any place in Waikiki. Loved my stay and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful place in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: John_Marlys
Reviews.Content: White Sands is a 3 story walk up built in the 50's style.We have stayed there many times. It is now owned by Aqua and they are doing lots of needed upkeep. The staff is very good including the housekeepers, front desk, maintainence and Paul (the manager). AND--yes we are going back in 2013.

Reviews.Title: “YUCK”
Reviews.Author: Islandguy808
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel on the back streets of Waikiki. I stayed there because they advertised parking for a fee and kitchenettes. There was no parking when I got there as their lot is tiny. They referred me to a private lot across the street. The ticket machine in that lot was not working so I had to park in another hotel lot on the next block that cost $25 per night. $25 per night parking is pretty standard for Waikiki. I went to use the kitchenette and found that every dinner plate in the cupboard had old food stuck too it which was disgusting. I picked up a water glass from the cupboard which was also filthy. They provided a kitchen cloth and dish towel but no detergent to clean the dishes. I would be afraid to eat off anything in those cupboards. I kicked off my shoes when I entered the room which is the Hawaiian style. After a few minutes I looked down at my socks and they were black. The floors were also very dirty. I took a cloth and wiped it across the light fixture in the bathroom it it came back full of dirt. The place is very dirty and I would not stay there again. I gave it a poor rather than terrible rating because the location is not bad and the front desk staff is very nice and really does try to help. My advice is pay a little more and stay somewhere else. I read several glowing reviews on TripAdvisor before booking. After seeing my room I checked the reviews again and noticed that many of them were written by people who had only ever done one review. This makes me wonder if they are reviews from real guests.

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Becca530
Reviews.Content: Staff was very nice and friendly. Hotel is in a good location, the pool area is very nice, and the rooms are kept clean. The only problem is a lack of parking spots, but otherwise I had a great stay and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Intimate – Hawaiian Style Hotel in Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Stkyricesf
Reviews.Content: If you’re not into the big box, impersonal hotels, this is the hotel for you. It is centrally located, nice room’s, great courtyard with a waterfall, pool, jacuzzi, trees and plants that gives you the most relaxing atmosphere you can have. Their best asset is there staff. They are extremely friendly and professional. One in particular is the customer service receptionist Christenna. She always has a smile and greeting for you and can help you with any questions you have about the facility or how to get to anyplace you want to go to. This hotel will definitely be my primary place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: Bert B
Reviews.Content: I will stay here again nice room wonderful staff price is right. no coffee maker in room, mentioned it to front desk next morning they brought me a new one. I needed to extend my stay 1 day But they were booked, Christie was wonderful and got me set up at a sister hotel across the street. Here on business traveling alone this is a bargain no frills hotel with a nice tropical courtyard and pool. perfect for me. Thank You

Reviews.Title: “More than you bargain! April 26-May 4 2012”
Reviews.Author: Jafet815418
Reviews.Content: Just return with my wife from waikiki HI stayed white sands Hotel and was suprised, big clean room #202 the staff was awesome,check in and out excellent, of course is not a big five star hotel, but is my fourth time in hawaii and i have done Hiltons, Ali condos, Marriott, and now White Sands, and i am going back to White Sands! saved money, great attention, on a perfect quite street a spot near everything ,shops, supermarkets, busstop, International market, Wakiki beach, can't ask for more, By this mean i do want to thank the white Sands staff for making my vacations so special on a good low budget. recomend this hotel. ( this opinion is from a person whos been traveling on his vacation for17 years around the world). Jafet Hernandez PR.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Monika C
Reviews.Content: We had a great time there recently. The room was big, clean, and opened onto the best little green courtyard in the middle of the otherwise concrete jungle that is Waikiki. If you have an easy-going personality and aren't expecting the Hilton, it'll work fine. It's been a while since the decor has been updated, but we really didn't care. Note: make sure you get a courtyard view - it'll make a huge difference to your stay. And we really appreciated that we had use of hotel facilities even after we checked out, as our plane didn't take off until 10:30 at night. Great experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for caring!”
Reviews.Author: shines247
Reviews.Content: The front seat girls are amazing. Go above & beyond! Great central location. I don't want to say budget but suuuuper cheap for Waikiki, great hospitality & close to all shops, beaches & buses:) For cheap accom & true Hawaiian hospitality it's Stella!:) Much mahalo Chris's & see ya at Karoke at The Outrigger Reef tomorrow :) Miss you my long lost Japanese Karaoke partners. The buy 1pint & the rest are free in our own personal room til 6am was clearly taken for granted & muchly missed!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and Friendly Staff but rooms need rennovations”
Reviews.Author: Aieagirl
Reviews.Content: White Sands Hotel has a very friendly, helpful staff and they do make you feel very welcome to the hotel. For the location and price it is perfect. The only bad part was the condition of the room I was in. It made me feel like I was 'stuck in the 70's' with old fixtures, about a 20 inch T.V. that was probably from the 80's (not flatscreen) and the condition of the vanity cabinets was pretty bad, bed was hard too. I really think all the hotel needs are rennovations to the rooms. The location was perfect, staff VERY friendly and helpful and the price was fantastic. So if you need a place to lay your head just for a night this would be the best bet because of the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: K K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the White Sands Hotel in Waikiki. Our first look into the hotel was the swimming pool which automatically we thought about our children and that we'd have to bring them here. The front office staff (Ron) was AMAZING! He answered our questions that we had and of course did so in a polite way. When we walked into our room it didn't stink, which is always a plus in our book. We had a queen and twin bed along with the kitchenette (which was a plus) on the third floor overing the pool and the room was cleaned everyday with fresh towels too. As an 'ohana we are planning on returning to the hotel July 2012, just before our keiki return to school. AWESOME overall experience! Location, staff, room, cleanliness, price!!

Reviews.Title: “All The Comforts Of Home!!”
Reviews.Author: Tammymi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the White Sands Hotel. The staff was great and very helpfu;. The room had everything we needed but instead of the queen size bed we had requested, we got 2 twin beds. The rooms were cleaned everyday and were clean when we arrived. The pool and hot tub was wonderful and the garden was beautiful. I would stay there again if I get the chance to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: kathyteufel
Reviews.Content: The White Sands Hotel is walking distance from Waikiki Beach and is one of the best inexpensive places to stay in the area except for the Hawaiian King next door. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Although the hotel is a little run down, the poolside rooms are the best, they are working hard to accommodate their guests and make improvements as they are able. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: mjhillyer
Reviews.Content: Best in Waikiki, this is truely a great little hotel, very friendly staff, great location, close to everything, clean room, wonderfull courtyard, within short walking distance to the beach. I tavel to Waikiki often have stayed at several hotels and this is truely the best. Cant wait to see you all May 7th.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Anna985
Reviews.Content: Nice quite and cousy hotel with lovely garden. I liked it was not one of those skyscrapers like most of Honolulu hotels are. The room was comfortable enough and very clean. Staff was really great - absolutely friendly and helpful-made me feel like home. Very good location - walk distance to the beach and bus stop is very close, easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “good value budget accom with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: blisteringbarnacles
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean, quiet, cheap and excellent location, nice old fashioned motel ambience, friendly staff Cons: Old, basic facilities eg no internet or hotel restaurant so in house dining not an option (although there is a very small and basic kitchenette in the room), hard bed

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: canucksfan88
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife were in Honolulu for 5 nights. For $85 a night in the middle of Waikiki this is a bargin. Rooms were not luxurious but that is not what we are paying for. Walking distance to everything. Best bang for your buck! Staff is friendly and helpful. Would definitely go there again. Not very kids friendly though as there is no elevator.

Reviews.Title: “you know im getting and grew up in the sixties”
Reviews.Author: l1jjc0x
Reviews.Content: both describe this place, but i dont mean negatively. if you walked in to the pool area surrounded by the hotel rooms (or years ago im sure motel), it looks like something out a 1960's spring break movie. Its in a good location in waikiki. rooms are clean, has a smal frig, 2 burner stove (at least mine did), free wifi worked well but i was close to the lobby and i dont know signal strenth someplace else. the place has a small pool that you can do lapsin and a great hot tub. cable is ok and the tv a brand i never heard of , but i didnt come to waikiki to watch tv. the place is cheaper than most and the kitchen is helpful to cut down on the bills. i rated it a 4 because the rate was good though they have raised their rates in the last year and a continuing trend in that direction may make looking at other places useful and this place no longer having frugal ambiance. HELPFUL hint 1: the bbq costs $10 to rent a day if that was factor in renting this place. helpful hint 2: if you are a lite sleeper ask for a room that doesnt face the multi story parking lot. helpful hint 3 -- the place has no elevators so unless you are into slogging your suitcases to the 3rd foor, request a room on 1 or 2. i usually rent on 2 as i prefer the lanais to the lanais on 1. helpful hint 4 -- and those under 45 owe me -- you can book at this place thru the waikiki ocean backpasckers at 1/3 less than an old guy like me can.

Reviews.Title: “Great older hotel with the friendliest and greatest staff !”
Reviews.Author: underwaterhairdryer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at White Sands just last week and had the most wonderful experience... First of all I understand that this is a budget hotel and I was worried about the location and staff and how safe it was going to be. White sands was one of two hotels we stayed in during our trip to Honolulu. We were checked in really fast and even that we were early, the room was ready. After getting into our room that was really nice and clean by the way, just had kind of an old hotel smell, but we were in Hawaii it is really humid and you will get used to that. First night was really relaxing and quiet. Second day however we had a leak and no one knew where the water was coming from, We talked to the guys at the front desk and the hotel was booked up so they couldn't move us and the moisture in the room was pretty uncomfortable. Old plumbing, old hotel. The security guard was amazing and said if we wanted to leave the door propped open he would make sure no one would walk in at night and guard it, he brought a boat load of towels and tried to dry the carpet. The next morning we came up to the front desk and we were told that the staff will move our bags into a new room and we do not have to worry about anything. and the new room was a really nice upgrade and all the staff was so apologetic... as I said it isan older hotel but the people working there are amazing and friendly and so helpful unlike most places we stayed in in Waikiki. the location of this hotel is actually pretty amazing, close to the beach, great restaurants and bus stops. Give this place a chance it is a great place with a very nice clean pool, great staff. amazing and personable manager. you won't regret your stay with The White Sands.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: Matt B
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were staying for a few nights until our other hotel room was ready. The rooms were pretty basic, old 70's kinda of curtains and bedding but the staff was wonderful. Our room had a leak that was coming from somewhere, they upgraded us to a better room with kitchenette and a nicer bathroom. They were more than happy to accommodate us and even gifted us a bottle of wine for the inconvenience! If you're looking for a basic room (you're gonna be out and about anyways), great customer service and smiles from the staff, this is a great choice! We will be returning to this hotel during the summer!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: YellowknifeFrozenOne
Reviews.Content: I wanted a cheap hotel room and that is exactly what I got. Bathroom floor was disgusting -even after requesting that the floor be cleaned again-still GROSS. I ended up scrubbing it myself -cloths came up pretty darn black! The single bed was comfortable but the queen needs a new mattress-it had large 'dips" in it. Didn't rent a car so no comment on the parking charge-please remember folks that you pay for parking EVERYWHERE on the island and parking space is at a premium. Noise-well maybe I am just getting old but it think the door slamming and partying should be done by midnite.... Nope - 2:30am the "exchange students" were still out and about.. Security did get them to quiet down tho. This hotel seems to be a mecca for language students and backpackers. OR the elderly. There was lots of early 20s folk and the balance seemed to be the elderly. Saw no families here. The Location was super tho! Only one block from Kuhio Ave and about 3 blocks from the beach. Very central and easy to get to. I would stay here again -now that I know to bring earplugs and Lysol wipes.

Reviews.Title: “Island Time”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca A
Reviews.Content: I needed to attend a seminar for 5 days in Honalulu. Cheap Tickets connected me with White Sands and I couldn't have been happier! I was able to cook 2 meals a day in room. Had all I needed. Centrally located in Waikiki,walking distance to beach,food stores,shopping and public transportation which I used everyday! There is a sufficient pool,hot tub and the most awesome locals running this place! Once per month they celebrate their staff with a luncheon on site and include awards! Is that happening at Marriot? I would return to White Sands with out a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the White Sands Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheOlsOns32999
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the White Sands Hotel in Waikiki. The Service desk was most kind and helpful. Cristina, Christlina and Christy-Ann were so pleasant to work with. Meeting Josiah at the tour desk was also a pleasure. Room service was especially good with the diamond jewel Harlene doing a super job for us. Ron at the service desk helped us out alot especially with the internet. Just a super experience in our lives staying at the White Sands Hotel. Kud

Reviews.Title: “I can't recommend this hotel to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: Soki816
Reviews.Content: We were flying out at 11:30 and decided to save some extra $ by staying here. We were given a room with 3 single beds. I felt as if I was back in a dorm room. The TV was awful. Only 7 American channels came in. There was hair all over the bathroom and in the sheets. We did manage to push together two of the beds to take a nap. The $15/nt parking is just another add-on. Positive is the location is two blocks from the strip and a block from some resteraunts.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Dumpy”
Reviews.Author: SML-Travels
Reviews.Content: I was looking for budget accommodations for a quick trip to Honolulu, and this hotel came up as a package option on Expedia. “Budget” doesn’t have to be synonymous with dirty or dumpy, but that’s pretty much how I’d have to sum up the White Sands Hotel. When we arrived, I discovered that the parking lot consisted of about 8 parking spaces. There was no parking garage. Even with my small economy car, it was tough to maneuver through this tight parking lot. This task was made even more difficult by someone’s long truck that was parked by the exit and hampered one’s ability to get through the tight turn. For this, you pay an extra $20 per day. We accessed our rooms by walking down a hallway with filthy carpets. It wasn’t a comforting first impression. Our “suite” came with two twin beds, a Hollywood-style daybed that doubles as a sofa, and a tiny kitchen. The beds must have had the cheapest mattresses the hotel could obtain, perched on wobbly metal frames. There was one small pillow on each bed. The scratchy blankets made me think longingly of my former Army barracks in basic training – the Army beds and blankets were more comfortable. My daughter pulled the blankets off one of the beds and slept on the daybed, as it had a slightly better mattress. The bathroom was none too clean – the floor could have used a good mopping with some strong cleaning fluid. The shower was about 30” by 30” in size. The kitchen consists of a microwave, a half-size refrigerator, a sink, and two burners. It’s very tiny, but was adequate for preparing breakfast cereal and light meals. I would have appreciated it if the kitchen had been stocked with some salt and pepper. The first night I was there, I poured some unused lemonade down the sink and didn’t notice that the sink stopper kept it from draining out of the sink. When I returned at the end of our first full day in Oahu, I noticed that the lemonade was still in the sink; the maids hadn’t drained it or cleaned it. As an experiment, I deliberately left it there the second day. It didn’t get cleaned then, either. There is a safe in the closet, which seemed like a good idea for security purposes, but you have to go to the lobby and obtain a key for $2/day for the privilege of using it. Better hotels have safes with combination locks that you can set yourself, and they don’t charge you for their use. The lanai “view” was non-existent, and there are no sheer curtains. It’s either reveal yourself to the world or have your room plunged into darkness by the drapes. The HVAC unit appeared to have a thermostat, but the A/C ran constantly, despite the setting. The wireless internet seemed to work adequately. The only reason that I ranked this hotel two stars is because one star is the minimum on TripAdvisor, and I’ve stayed at two other motels in my lifetime that have been worse. Since the locks and deadbolts worked, I didn’t feel overly worried about my safety, and at least the maids had made an attempt to clean the unit before our arrival. And the air conditioning worked, so we didn’t roast. I have to admit that the hotel was surprisingly un-noisy for its location in a busy urban section of Waikiki. If all you want is a place to crash, this might be OK, but I think there must be better budget options out there.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: john p
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in Sept. 2011 & really enjoyed it. We were upgraded free to a large double room with a view of the hot tub & swimming pool. Everything in the rooms worked & the staff were friendly & very helpful! We were close to everything & had an assigned parking space. If we go back to Oahu we'll surely stay here again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: howardchang79
Reviews.Content: Pros: Has a fridge and stove. Quiet. Price Cons: Dingy. Parking is $25 a night. No internet signal in my room. No elevator to third floor. I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, substandard cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Sapphire963
Reviews.Content: Loved the location--within walking distance from the beach, shops, etc. of Waikiki. The pool area was beautifully landscaped. Our balcony faced the pool so the view was excellent. The desk staff were very friendly and accomodating. Now the bad--I found several foreign hairs on the bathroom and kitchen floor when we checked in--the floors had obviously not been swept and mopped. I had to ask to have the maid to clean the floor in order for it to get cleaned at all during our stay. The hall carpets of this hotel are ratty and stained. Nobody clued us in that we had to use the computer cord in the room to access WIFI--when we initially asked why we couldn't get it in the room the staff told us we could only access it in the lobby near the wireless router on the front desk. The last day of our trip we realized we could have had WIFI the whole time! I would probably stay elsewhere my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greg3987
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay for our budget holiday in Oahu. Can't beat the price for location and a pretty good pool. Booked the cheapest room and had a view of a wall but that's the way it goes for $80 in Waikiki. Kitchenette was a bonus but could of used a better cleaning, room was good size, 26" tv, ice maker and laundry in lobby. Wifi in lobby and at pool and maybe in some pool view rooms. Easy walking distance to most things in Waikiki and there are some cheaper restaurants close by, the busiest nightclubs are 2 blocks away. We paid $18 a day for parking and the lot was full on the weekend, never saw any empty street parking stalls in five days so best to reserve a spot. Overall a good stay but we new not to expect anything special. If you have never stayed in a budget hotel before you might be disappointed but I feel it is one of best deals in Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “good for budget”
Reviews.Author: travelapple
Reviews.Content: if your not looking for fancy ocean front hotel and you want a good location on a budget the White Sands is a fair place. looks like it used to be an apratment complex, pool in center courtyard is nice with pretty trees! rooms are fine ours had a little kitchenette too with a lanai overlooking the pool! not too modern but on a budget its fine, fairly clean but again older buildings,walking distance to everywhere, friendly staff also!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: WahineAnacortes
Reviews.Content: As a long time Hawaiiana customer I was thrilled to find that the entire staff had gone to work at the White Sands Hotel, formerly known as Celebrity Resorts. I was uncomfortable with the location after dark, but seeing the same familiar faces year after year is the draw for me, especially Lisa and Christieann. I had two stays at White Sands since the closing of the Hawaiiana and had two more planned. I was disappointed to find that a management company was hired and Lisa was let go with one days notice. I cannot support a business that treats its long time loyal employees with such insensitivity. I cancelled my reservation and will not be staying there again. I am currently trying to find a new place to call "home" if anyone has any recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Talquinho
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this property, now re-named White Sands Hotel (Trip Advisor please note and update) from March 8 to 13. We were a bit apprehensive after booking it online with Hotwire.com, but took a risk. The hotel is about a half block away from the Ala Wai canal and about 3 blocks from the beach, in the opposite direction. It's exactly adjacent to the Ilima Hotel, for reference (the Ilima seems better known in case you need pick-ups/drop-offs, etc.). The block itself is a bit run down, but only that. We always felt perfectly safe (and, for that matter, felt so everywhere in Waikiki and greater Honolulu). The location allows you to walk pretty much everywhere you'd care to go in Waikiki and is very close to major bus stops if you're using transit to get around. As you'll read elsewhere, the hotel is a collection of three, three-storey buildings, none with elevator. It seemed to us that the elderly guests were all placed in ground-floor rooms. This is a hotel in serious need of investment and renovation. The hallway on the third floor of the main building (where we stayed) had carpet that bordered on nauseating, in terms of its cleanliness and advanced age. The room was a fair bit better, but still very aged and dated. The furniture appeared to have been selected from thrift shops and garage sales, although the bed was comfortable and in good condition. The kitchenette consisted of a two-burner range, sink, min-fridge (large enough for two people's use), microwave (very clean) and various utensils and dishes. Our bathroom appeared original to the building's construction, but the plumbing worked very well. Good strong shower, good water pressure in the sink and throne. I noted only one multi-legged visitor during our stay, who confined himself to the bathroom and came and went very quickly (and about which I didn't tell my wife until this very moment). There's a nice pool and, well-hidden behind it, a jacuzzi pool. The whole area was quiet and lightly-used during our stay. It closes at 9 pm. Wi-fi, at least in our room, was so spotty as to be almost useless, but the signal in the lobby and pool area is roaring strong. The lobby itself has a rack of brochures, pamphlets and the ubiquitous "what-to-do" magazines. They often contain a variety of useful coupons. It seemed to us that the hotel is used as a student residence, as we saw a lot of a young woman, in business dress and with a clipboard, greeting and escorting arriving young guests to their rooms. If those guests are indeed students, they were quiet and unobtrusive. The hotel staff themselves are uniformly pleasant and helpful. We were unsuccessful in bending their arms to extend our check-out time beyond an extra hour, but they were happy to give us towels and let us lie by the pool until it was time to leave for the airport. We paid about $500 for our 5-night stay, which seems reasonable on the whole. We likely wouldn't choose to stay there again but don't recommend against it as a choice for others. Just do remember you're likely not paying very much and shouldn't expect a lot either. Do ask for a pool-view room; the "city-view" ones overlook the dingy and depressing parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Ownership changes and now called White Sands. Older hotel but good.”
Reviews.Author: organicgreenthumb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at White Sands for 6 nights in September 2010 and will stay again. This hotel is 4 stories high without an elevator. I stayed on the second floor with a room overlooking the pool area. Pros: - 4 blocks from Waikiki beach - Large rooms with kitchen (fridge, 2-burner stove, sinkm 2-person dining table) - Air conditioned - Small pool w/BBQ area - TV w/cable - Fold out couch - Coin-op laundry - Cleaning service everyday. Never saw a bug - No street noise - Large lanai Cons: - Older hotel - No elevator (but not a problem since we were on the 2nd floor) - Smoke detector chirped in the hallway like it needed batteries replaced. Told the front desk but it was never fixed. Slept with earplugs. - No bathtub (but nice walk in shower) Overall we're very happy with the room. It's an oldie but goodie and the price was excellent. If we can get the same price in the future we'll be staying there again. It's on Nohonani between the International Market and the canal. It's a great location and we had no problem getting around. We took Robert's shuttle from the airport to the hotel (drop off at Ilima which is next door to the White Sands) and walked or took the Bus everywhere. If you need to rent a car there's an Enterprise across the street which is convenient for pick up and drop off but the prices are more expensive than if you had rented from the airport. Tip - Pick up those tourist magazines, there are a lot of coupons in them.

Reviews.Title: “warmest winter of my life !”
Reviews.Author: phattal
Reviews.Content: when we first arrived we were coming 4 a anniversery it almost turned into a divorce party..But as things went on they got nothing but better. The staff was a- Ok . First nite we got lost 4 3 Hrs. Thanx Briane could,nt have made it without/u you da man.And lady Catheryn girl u can really lay out a game plan. Arron truly the cooliest brother on th e beach And last But certainl not lease the Mayor George and the first lady megd. Much love Al and phyllis Akron,Ohio 4 sho Oh, YeaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaH !!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We Love Celebrity Resort Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: SWIMMERS_SKIERS
Reviews.Content: About to plan our 4th trip to Celebrity Resort Waikiki, stayed 3 times in 2008. Just checked online and they don't appear to be operating under this name anymore, does anyone know if they are still operating? Basic accommodation, but great value and fantastic location in the heart of Waikiki. Staff are great too.

Reviews.Title: “Stop! Don't do it.”
Reviews.Author: myvoiceofreason
Reviews.Content: Celebrity Resort Waikiki April 6-15, 2009. Room 327. STOP! Unless you are staying at the Celebrity for free … and even then...don’t even think about it. I am at a loss as to why so many people give this place a decent rating. It’s run down and in serious need of a small, controlled fire. You can easily find other properties in Waikiki for the same price. Still not convinced? Read on. Before I go any further, in agreement with some of the other reviews, I have to say that the staff here are great. The desk staff are generally happy and helpful and the room staff keep the rooms clean..and that is no small task given the condition of the things. So…The Celebrity Resort is one of those quintessential 1950s-era block motels that you really want to like. The pics on their website show the décor and the prices (starting at $79/night for a studio) clue you into the fact that this place is not high-end and that’s fine. Honolulu is full of over-priced tower hotels so finding a small, cool motel in Waikiki would be great. However, the Celebrity is not it. The website offers the following quote.. “Situated amongst the hustle and bustle of metropolis Waikiki, the resort maintains the ambiance of Hawaii as it used to be 40 years ago - where the surf, sun and sea lull you into a tropical euphoria.” Sounds great. You’re thinking Ernest Hemingway’s Hawaii and a lush plantation resort on the ocean, right? Ok, let me translate that into plain, brutally honest English for you. “Set back on a dirty street within walking distance of a bunch of crappy souvenir stores and cheap bars, but nowhere near close enough to hear or see the suff the resort, which has not been updated in 40 years –offers noise, odors and rundown interiors which send you into a catatonic state.” We stayed in room 327 and 327a. These two rooms, a studio with kitchenette and a single hotel room have an adjoining door and are combined to make a 1 bedroom/ 2 bath suite though there is nothing sweet about it. Rooms 321-335 (odd numbers) on this side of the property face the street and they are both loud and not at all private. The garbage trucks (plural… I counted three) start about 6am and then it’s non-stop noise well into the night. However, if you’re into being an exhibitionist and fool enough to stay here…these rooms are perfect as no less than 100 apartments across the street have a clear view directly into these rooms and on the patios. The beds and the furnishing in the rooms (at least 327 and 327a) are bad, thread-bare and stained. The bathrooms are outdated and the tile in the showers is cracked and perma-stained. The water pressure is quite good so there’s something positive. Both rooms have a separate AC unit to keep the place cool if you need to chill for a bit and they are loud enough to block out the traffic noise. The kitchenette in the studio has a coffee pot, microwave, toaster oven, two burner stove top and a small mini-fridge. There are glasses, plates, knives and flatware. Not great stuff but it does the job if you want to stay in and cook something simple. The common areas of the hotel are a little better but still outdated and generally borderline junk. Yes, there is a pool in the center courtyard and if you have small children they will think it’s great. The beach is about a 3-5 minute walk away and you end up beach front at the Royal Hawaiian. The front desk at the Celebrity will give you towels, beach mats, etc. Just ask. I like to stay at a variety of places and I generally prefer to steer clear of the big name hotel chains as I traveled for business for a good 10 years and stayed in them too much. I like to find smaller, more hands-on hotels and motels that offer something out of the norm. But again, this place is not it. It’s just plain bad. Do your homework. If you want to stay in Waikiki there are a number of other properties in the same price range that have invested in updating and offer good quality interiors and furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “Our Fav”
Reviews.Author: myhavaii
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Celebrity in March for 8 days. We didn't get the room we had hoped for, but upon arrival accomodated us nicely and now we have a new favorite room! The place is very homey and comfortable. Close to everything and has everything you need close at hand. We have been here twice now and hope to come back again. The staff are wonderful and accomodating and the hotel is kept wonderfully clean. Aaron is a real gem! Used the bbq, the hall computer, pool and laundry facilites. So much nicer than the high rise we stayed at before. We walked everywhere. I pray they don't tear this place down and build a high rise in its place. God bless all of you may this place continue to thrive as it is. Miriam- Toronto Canada

Reviews.Title: “Love the Celebrity Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: trixi
Reviews.Content: As usual, our stay at the Celebrity was wonderful. Nice pool and hot tub. Very clean and attentive cheerful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wow..Great Family place in the heart of it all.”
Reviews.Author: alohaSaskatoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Celebrity from January 26th - Feb 16/2009 This hotel is perfect. It is very old but well kept. There are always people walking around picking up falling leaves and cleaning the pool. There is no other place that I would stay in Waikiki. It is 3 floors max and no elevators to wait for. All rooms come with a small kitchen that is perfect if you are wanting to save a few buck. There are also 2 gas BBQ's on site (which was awesome). The hot tub is perfect but the pool was a bit cold...never stopped my kids from jumping in. They also have a computer to use there and coffee down stairs every morning from 7am to 10am. There is a laundry room there that has 2 washers & 2 dryers. The staff was perfect..I have never been treated so good in all my life... Would I stay here again...No questions about it....This is the best place to stay in Hawaii. If you are expecting the Hilton, you will be dissapointed. But if you love beautiful grounds (Back yard feeling) you will love this place..

Reviews.Title: “"At home" at the Celebrity”
Reviews.Author: George80
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at the Celebrity for eight nights(Jan.21 to Jan 28,2009) My review title includes " at home" and that is what it was like to be a guest at this great 'oasis' type accomodation. The rooms are spacious,very clean with a great bed,kitchen,sofa and large bathroom.The property itself is very much like an oasis conventiently located to the beach,food and shoping.Minutes of walking to any of these locations. The staff are exceptional. Friendly,helpful,courteous and extremely accomodatiing. I found it difficult to leave such a friendly atmosphere. Its a must stay if you are travelling to Honolulu and want to be near the beach. A very safe area. I highly recommend this exceptional property.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Oasis!”
Reviews.Author: ScottK1973
Reviews.Content: From the outside, it loooks like a cheap budget motel, but we were amazed as we walked through the lobby which opens up into a beautiful courtyard, with a smimming pool, jaccuzi, and waterfalls. You feel like you're in some hidden resort in the middle of the jungle. There is also 2 barbeques for the guests to use free of charge. (most hotels don't have any, or charge you per use.) The rooms were average, but clean and spacious. We've stayed in other hotels in the area, that were half the size, but cost more. The courtyard view is based on availability, and can't be booked in advance, . They assign the rooms as you check in. If you're lucky, you can get a room facing the pool at no extra charge. If you don't get one, don't be disappointed. You will still enjoy your stay, and the staff are awesome. We ended up getting a room with a city view, but it's only 10 feet to the pool, and the resort is only 5 minutes to the beach. In my opinion, you shouldn't come to Hawaii, and spend your entire day looking at the other guests in the pool, when you're a block from the beach anyway! Brian and Aaron at the front desk were the best. Both were so friendly, and they helped us so much. They introduced us all the best restaurants and all of the hot spots to go at night. They also have a great conceirge that can help you book the best luaus and dinner cruises, and they don't try to rip you offf, or upsell you on the higher ticket activities like some do. The only disadvantage was the parking. They only have 12 stalls, which are always full, but they have alternate parking right across the street for the same price. Overall, our stay was with a large grocery store just a block out the back gate. We would highly recommend the resort, and plan on staying again next time were were in town.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes! What a dive...and not the blue ocean water kind.”
Reviews.Author: CaryBerry
Reviews.Content: Despite the fancy pictures on the corporate website - this property is in dire conditions. The desk staff and folks working there are very nice but that's where the nice stops. We did not know that this property is actually part of a time-share collection. If I paid time-share prices for a week here - I would be pissed off! The "resort" is old and very run down. The furniture is used to the point of non-functional. There is no elevator, so be prepared to drag your luggage up 2-3 flights of stairs. The carpet in the rooms and halls are just gross. Will not ever return to this hotel or recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “HIdden gem”
Reviews.Author: indigoforest
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Celebrity Resorts for six nights in June. We were in the market for a Waikiki hotel that was budget-friendly and centrally located. We had also decided that since we were traveling so far, for such a short period of time, we were going to spend as much time out and about as we could - we didn't intend to spend a lot of time in a hotel room. Essentially, we were looking for a decent place to sleep and a safe place to store our things. We were met at the front desk by Aaron and Joemar. I asked if they had a room on the courtyard side available. Aaron said they had one, but it was a smoking room. He offered to take me to see it before finalizing our transaction. I was afraid it was going to have a stale smoky smell, but much to my surprise, it was fine - no trace of smoke, and truthfully, I don't recall even having seen an ashtray in the room. We have nothing to complain about our stay there. The front desk staff was friendly, the poolside pancake breakfast was fun, the concierge service was a plus - I can't remember the young lady's name, I want to say it was Kealia - I'm so sorry I can't remember the spelling - but she was so sweet, and so helpful in getting us tickets for a sunset catamaran cruise, and tickets for Pearl Harbor. They have a small hut where they store pool toys and boogie boards - guests are welcome to take those boogie boards over to Waikiki Beach. On the Sunday we were there, we decided we were going to explore the beaches on the eastern coast, and in Kailua, we bought 2 boogie boards of our own. Since we knew we wouldn't be able to bring them back on the plane, we left them as a thank you to the staff for the awesome time we had there, and also in the hopes that other guests would have as much fun boogie boarding as we did. We only had a car for 3 days of our trip, parking at the resort was unavailable, but parking garages are nearby, albeit rather expensive, and with time limits. One morning, my boyfriend was up at 5:00 AM in order to move the car to a different location. If you don't need a car, don't get one - public transportation is reliable, efficient and inexpensive. If you're expecting the Ritz, you're going to be disappointed and I recommend you keep going, but, if you're looking for a safe, clean, reasonably priced place to stay, where the staff greets you by name, please try Celebrity Resorts. We'll definitely consider it again if we're fortunate enough to return.

Reviews.Title: “laid back atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: lenwad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a family visit in Honolulu, Hawaii.We stayed at the Celebrity resorts Waikiki. We have traveled extensively and have been visiting the Island since 1969. If your tired of the mega roomed hotels that have upscaled the cost and not the experience then this is the place to be. The laid back atmosphere and tropical area around the pool is just what you have been looking for. But most important is the staff. They treat everyone as a person not just a guest. They are the greatest asset of all. Thank you all Marie, Joemar, Brian, And Aarron. With a big HUG and thanks to Judy the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Great location + Great price = Great economical vacation”
Reviews.Author: AvonMike
Reviews.Content: Second time there, so we knew what we were getting for the money. Room overlooking nicely landscaped pool area; hot tub; two gas grills around many umbrella-topped tables; full lanai; fully-equipped kitchen; central laundry room; great staff; beach/dining/shopping/food stores within 1-3 blocks. Saved enough money here to do all those romantic dinners, sunset cruises, night spots, tours, and car rentals to the North and East Shores, etc. Got some shrimp, steaks, and wine, and had two of the best dinners of the trip right there. Things to note - A/C unit in each room - ours was noisy and not too strong; not 'full' maid service each day; no elevators (3 story max); some rooms face out to street (not too pretty); two blocks to beach (easy walk); $4/day fee for safe, coffee, phone added; pool a bit chilly (but ocean is perfect!); sun for about 5 hours/day (10-3) in pool area (but ocean is perfect!). Overall, as long as you know what you are getting for the money, this is the best deal in Waikiki we know of.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise visited”
Reviews.Author: sarniaman
Reviews.Content: Booked a 1 Bedroom Suite and was impressed with the size. It had 2 bathrooms 2 balconies large lounge with kitchen area bedroom was same size as lounge. the Hotel was located just off the main street area convenient for the excelent bus service and shopping. If you are in any doubt about the value for money just compare with other hotels and you will see the others only give you a small room for a lot more money. This hotel may not look the best from the outside but don't let this put you off it is clean and tidy on the inside and staff are A1

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Value”
Reviews.Author: clydei
Reviews.Content: We stayed here November 1-8, 2008. The reviews I read were decidedly mixed but in spite of this I booked a stay in a 1 bedroom suite. The suite consists of 2 hotel rooms with a connecting door. One room is set up as a bedroom with a bath, the queen sized bed looks tiny in the room, the other room is set up as a living room and a kitchen as well as a bath. The living room has 2 couches that are pullouts that are serviceable but not great beds. The rooms were clean and the maid service was exactly as the hotel described. The staff was very friendly and helpful. When we checked in we were given a very complete run-down of the activities and services the hotel provides. Wireless internet is provided as part of the 3.99 per night resort fee as is access to the "business center" computer and printer. If you are looking for luxury and ocean view, keep looking, if you are looking for value and expect to spend your days at the beach or seeing the many sites this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “will recommend”
Reviews.Author: me_nutz2
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this resort is a result of an exchange via RCI. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Lobby had a computer which we could use to check email or surf the internet. Coffee is served every morning. Pool is small but during our stay there we never seem to see more than a couple of people swimming. Chairs and recliners around the pool make a good relaxing place to relax and read a book. You can even borrow some chairs and floats to take to the beach. Parking is the worst part. Be ready to pay $18/day. Tiny spaces so if you have a big car or truck...good luck trying to make it fit! Only a few spaces available on site but you can park at the covered garage across the street for the same price. We parked across the street and it may be a better deal if you don't mind the walk. Parking is plentyful and covered. We had a one bedroom and a living room that faces the pool. The rooms were clean. The bed was quite comfortable although it may need to be changed soon as it is starting to sag towards the middle. The bathrooms are small but clean and shower area tiny. A/C had no problem cooling the rooms, 1 in the bedroom and 1 in the kitchen/dining/living room area. The freezer in our ref had a big gash/hole on it but didn't have a problem freezing the water in our water bottles. Location I believe is the best part. Walking distance to the beach, International Market, Starbucks, Jack in the Box, Mc Donald's, IHOP, Denny's and other local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Point2point
Reviews.Content: Celebrity Resorts Waikiki was a good place to stay. Low rise, not fancy, fewer people, inviting courtyard and pool area, friendly staff are all plusses. The secret to this place seems to be getting a room on the inner courtyard, not on the periphery. We booked a n/s 1 bdr for 2 adults/2 kids. There are smoking rooms/floors as well as non-smoking, but the inner courtyard area is non-smoking. Smokers have an area provided in the parking lot. Service: We checked in late, so there wasn't much available except a room facing Nohonani St. Staff was very friendly, helpful and efficient. Thank you to Judy, Marie, Joemar, Brian, Jocelyn and the always-smiling Aaron! The staff were happy to book shuttles, give dining advice, etc. Late check-out was provided, and other travellers were able to use common areas until their very late departure. Most of the guests were friendly and courteous, although we encountered two self-centred jet-lagged parents who let their toddler scream loudly on the lanai at 3:30 am. The security person was already out there when I opened the balcony door. I tried to get their attention by leaning over and waving and yelling, but said oblivious parent was too busy watching TV to notice some stranger near their kid on the balcony. The security lady ended up knocking on their door and asked them to respect the quiet hours rule. Room: The 1 bdr was large, but we were disappointed that it wasn't a courtyard/pool view room. Although I asked daily about changing, it was a busy week. Facing the street, it wasn't terribly private, but it was bright if you opened the curtains. 2 queen sofabeds in the living area, so both kids got their own bed. The bedroom's queen bed was comfortable enough but seemed small. Loved the many extra pillows in the room! TVs in both the living area and bedroom, but limited TV channels. DVD player & DVDs can be rented at the front desk. The safe in the room was useful, although it will not hold a laptop computer. Air conditioning in each room was noisy, as were the garbage trucks that hit various buildings in the area. We counted 4 on Wed. (from 6 am on), and 1 each day except Sunday. The earliest one was at 5:36 am, and the driver was banging the dumpster around with vengeance. As a light sleeper I definitely needed earplugs, but the rest of the family was fine. Kitchenette: small beer fridge (used the crisper drawer for milk) with ice cube tray, 2 burner stove, microwave oven, toaster oven, cutlery (& steak knives!) and dishes. Coffee maker & filters provided, but it was more convenient and fun to have Kona and Vanilla Macnut coffee out by the pool (avail. 7-10 am). Salt & pepper provided; sugar and coffee whitener avail. at morning coffee. No dishwasher, only a dishrack. Bathrooms: the 1 bdr had 2 identical bathrooms on each side of the unit. Toilets flush loudly and run long. Shower pressure and temperature were great in the morning, although one afternoon the temp was only warm. The shower heads were really low at 5'4", so at 5'6" I had to bend my knees to wash my hair. Housekeeping: according to something I read at the hotel, Heavy housekeeping was done on Wed. & Sat., including changing sheets & washing dishes. We washed our own. Lite housekeeping involved making beds & changing towels on all other days. For some inexplicable reason, the maid never left extra shampoo or soap in either bathroom. We had one soap for the shower and sink area until I went downstairs to ask for more. Amenities: small, warm, deep swimming pool (4-7 ft). Pool and beach toys available in pool shack (air mattresses, tubes, boogie boards, beach chairs, umbrellas, beach mats, pails and shovels). Beach and pool towels are signed out at the front desk. Plenty of tables with umbrellas by the pool, although it gets very busy during the pancake breakfast on Thurs. morning. Lounge chairs by pool. Hot tub secluded in far part of courtyard, hidden by palm trees, plants, and waterfall. NY Pizza/cheesecake night is on Tuesdays. Internet access in lobby was useful for quick inquiries. Did not use the booking agent, but it seemed convenient to have that service available. Neighborhood: Within a block of the hotel on Kuhio, you can find fast food: Subway, Jack in the Box (all day breakfast), sushi, Pukadog, Starbucks, Fatty's Chinese, Denny's, McDonald's (2 blks west), St. Germain bakery with cheap, appealing sandwiches and pastries. More formal restaurants are within a few blocks. Shopping: ABC store (with booze), Payless shoes, pharmacy (one block east), Food Pantry (2 blocks east). The International Marketplace is within the block, full of cheap "Let's make a deal" souvenir merchandise and a small food court. Kalakaua, the action packed main drag is a quick 5 minutes away, and free entertainment abounds at night, including street performers, fancy stores and restaurants (Cheesecake Factory, CPK, etc). Kuhio Beach (Duke's statue) is the big main beach. Just north is the Ala Wai canal - good for a walk or run. We never felt unsafe, but then, we never stayed out very late, either. The hotel is secured after 8 pm, and key cards are a must. There is an exit at the back of the complex as well. I have recommended this hotel to similar-minded travellers and will return, hopefully in the off-season.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay here”
Reviews.Author: ecm_tx
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. Before arriving I was a little nervous after reading some of the negative reviews but it didn't take long to feel right at home. These accommodations are by no means perfect but I'm giving it 5 stars because it was my experience that within just a few hours we were able to make this apartment-style hotel room a home away from home. Upon arriving we went to the front desk where Joemar and Aaron helped check us in. They were both incredibly helpful and friendly. In fact, I would say their smiles were contagious. We requested a room facing the pool area and were fortunate enough to get one. We ended up with a room overlooking the pond and spa which turned out to be perfect because it was a little more private and it was right next to the back entrance for easy in and out access. Before raving more about the good I think it's only fair to align any future expectations with the reality of a 2.5 star hotel. When we first walked into our room it's fair to say my roach motel fears didn't vanish immediately. It definitely had an unappealing musty smell. The bedroom floor had a huge iron burn on the carpet (it was literally the full size and shape of the bottom of an iron). Not once did we see any bugs of any kind inside our suite but one of our 7 mornings there we did see a single, but live, roach in the hallway. Housekeeping was pretty good but you should expect to do your own dishes (we left $3 on average for tip each day) and one of the 8 days we were there our bed looked made but the sheets under the comforter had not been touched and were in complete disarray. Now, you are probably asking yourself how I could possibly rate it a 5 after all that but let me explain. First off, never have I made myself so at home at any other hotel I've ever stayed in. By day 2 my friend and I had literally unpacked everything in our suitcases. Shirts and shorts were hanging in the 2 closets, our bathroom amenities were each stowed away in our own separate bathroom mirror cabinets. We stayed in one of the Bedroom Suites. It had a sitting room with two pullouts, a full kitchen, a bedroom and 2 full bathrooms. Since it was just the 2 of us we didn't really need the 2 bathrooms but it certainly ended up being convenient to have all the extra counter and storage space. Once the AC is running a while the smell goes away and you won't think about it again. Since we really did feel at home it didn't bother us when our dishes didn't get cleaned or the one time our sheets weren't perfect. My friend in particular is pretty anal when it comes to cleanliness and other than the initial smell and the partially made bed she had no complaints. The first night we got in we went to the grocery store down the road and filled up our fridge with sandwich stuff, eggs, yogurt, etc. Most of the days we'd get up early, eat breakfast, spend the day out and then come back to the room for dinner on the lanai and then spend the rest of the day walking Waikiki Beach or sitting by the pool. It was a very welcoming and relaxing place to return to after a long day of sightseeing and sunbathing. If we come back we'll definitely be looking up Celebrity Resorts Waikiki again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel on a Crowded Island”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiRocks08
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for the money. We were a bit cramped with 4 people in the room and all of our luggage; used the bed and the pull out sofa bed.
