There is a small kitchenette which adequately served our needs: had a small refrigerator, microwave, cooktop and coffee maker. All rooms have some type of patio or balcony. Unfortunately we were assigned a room with no view so we did not use this feature. Request a room with a pool view. There are various brews of free coffee in the morning by the pool area where you can sit and relax and enjoy your coffee. Very limited parking accommodations even though you pay a daily fee to park (but this seems to be the norm and not the exception these days on Oahu). Once they run out of parking spaces at this hotel they have an agreement where you can use a hotel's parking garage across the street at a reduced fee but still higher than the fee that you pay to park in this hotel's lot. Even though we prepaid for this hotel, was charged an additional $3.99/day for a resort fee. I must say that the pool area is very nice, the hotel is located close to Kuhio Avenue (major shopping on this street; close to International Market), and not that far from the beach and the great public transportation that this island offers. The hotel has pizza parties and other activites that the hotel guests can participate in (for a fee). The absolute best thing about this hotel is the front desk staff....they were extremely kind, pleasant, professional and courteous all of the time! Although there is a desktop computer located across from the front desk that can be used by the hotel guests the front desk staff was able to provide directions and answer all questions. If they already didn't have preprinted directions available they were more than glad to print up whatever you requested. The people behind the front desk are gems! Overall, a nice hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: wynn0029
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for eight nights and could not have been more pleased. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite overlooking the garden and pool. The suite was large enough for four adults (six one night). The place was very clean, had a well stocked kitchen and a large lanai. Both the bed in the bedroom and the one in the living room were very comfortable. There was a queen size sofa pullout as well. The staff was super helpful and friendly. Morning coffee and free internet with printing was provided. The location was close to everything. We walked or took the bus to most of the major attractions on Oahu. We rented a car for day trips from the Enterprise rental office located right across the street for exploring the North Shore. I would definitely stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep...”
Reviews.Author: icelara
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading a lot of positive reviews on TripAdvisor. A lot of things about the hotel are true. The service is great....when we checked in, Judy let us check out a couple of different rooms when we asked if we could get a room with a view of the courtyard. She let us check the one that was available with a view, although she said it was smaller than what we were supposed to have. Then she let us check out the room we were supposed to get that had a view of the parking lot. We ended up going with the smaller room with a view as we didn't need the pullout sofa. Aaron and Joemar also helped us out during our stay by giving directions to certain sights and helping us get our taxi to the airport. They were all very courteous and happy to help. We had no problems with housekeeping either, and our room was always clean when we came back in the evening. The coffee in the morning was nice, and the place seemed to have lots of activities for the people staying there although we didn't really take advantage of that. There is a computer in the lobby to use the internet, as well as an activities desk. The room itself....was just ok. It is obviously an older room, and it was pretty small, although it had a small kitchen, and we only really used the fridge. There was no tub (only a shower) in both the rooms we looked at. The bed was just ok to sleep in, but after a long day, it doesn't matter as long as you have a place to sleep. We pretty much kept the A/C on all day so it only smelled a little funny when you walked in, but otherwise the smell went away. The location of the hotel itself is fine. It is across the street from the International Marketplace and is just a short walk to the beach. We rented a car for one day, and fortunately found street parking on Ala Wai Blvd because we were told there were no more spots left for our car. It would have been a problem had we rented for more than one day. Overall, this is a place to crash for the night. We pretty much spent all of our time outside of the hotel, so it was fine, but if people prefer to hang out in their rooms to relax, this probably isn't the place you want to do that.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend...”
Reviews.Author: AlohaKatie99
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Celebrity Resorts-Waikiki for 6 nights in May 2008. To start: The check-in went pretty good.The location -I don't think- is good at all. It is a block from a strip-club and at night street walkers and dive bars are right around the corner. The resort staff was a bit over whelming for my family, but they were nice. I don't think that you should have to pay $10/day for parking, seems a bit much. Also they charge a $3.99/day fee for coffee in the AM and the safe, both of which we did not use. The room. REALLY outdated. It was pretty clean, had an old smell and a window AC unit. It had to run full balst to remain cool. Small fridge in our room. Beds are small and not comfortable. Overall, this was not my ideal Hawaiian vacation and would not recommend this location. I have stayed at other Celebrity Resorts (CO) and they were MUCH nicer. If you are literally looking for a place to sleep, this is your place. If you are looking for anything else, I would search elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location in Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Dacquiri24
Reviews.Content: Have just been staying for 3 nights at this hotel. As a woman travelling alone, I must say that it has been ideal: I got the room type that I requested (2nd floor, with lanai, facing pool courtyard). Room has basic cooking facilities - very handy. Staff are friendly and helpful, activities desk is excellent, free coffee in the morning. Best thing is the location: on a quiet side street just off of Kuhio. Amazing bakery & an ABC Store at the corner, larger Food Pantry (pricey but OK for short time) up the road, zillions of shops of all types within minutes' walk, including market stalls (beware predatory stallholders! if you act interested, they will pounce!). Walking distance to the beach, too. Only criticisms are: room security could be improved (in-room safe but no chain on door & only very basic door lock; and only 1 simple up/ down lock on sliding door to lanai). Also, there is a musty smell in the room when you first enter, but this disappears when a/c is run. Room was well cleaned, no problems with sheets, towels, etc. Am staying here again in a couple of weeks, so will report back if experience is any different. BTW, hotel recommended Reliable Shuttle for airport transport, and they were also excellent. All in all, a very pleasant place, esp. for people looking for something smaller and friendlier than a high-rise.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I thought”
Reviews.Author: JennieS_8
Reviews.Content: We booked the Celebrity Resorts Waikiki after reading the reviews from other travellers. I had to switch rooms after my first night. The pull out bed was blood stained and the small lanai faced an apartment building with a view of the tenants' garbage. The first front desk clerk I spoke to said there were no rooms available to switch. But after my travel agent contacted them, there were two rooms available that they could move us to. We were moved to another room that seemed cleaner but a similar view. Another front desk clerk, Aaron, was helpful the rest of the trip offering suggestions for dining, etc. He made an effort to learn guests' names, acknowledged anyone who walked through the lobby and offered my daughter flowers on the last day. He was a gem! I did not have trouble with housekeeping as previously inidicated by another guest. A nice little touch was a white board in the room so if you had any requests or comments for housekeeping, you could indicate it on the white board. What a great idea! The location was good, the staff were helpful (except our first night), they have free internet use with a 10 minute limit, and an activities desk to get information on the area. They also offered free scuba lessons in the pool on Tuesdays. However, the rooms were not what I expected. We ended up being in three different studio rooms during our stay (we paid $10 to use a room to shower in on our last day after we had already checked out), and none of them were the same. The "shower room" that we used was cleaner, bigger kitchenette, bigger lanai and bigger bathroom. I think you have to be very specific on your needs when selecting a room or you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “economical - that's it”
Reviews.Author: pamsadventures
Reviews.Content: The room was very dated, & smelled of mildew as per previous reviews. We asked for a room facing the courtyard as per previous travellors suggestions, but they were not able to honour that. I decided to go with celebrity because of the kitchenette facilities, but it was not worth it. I think we got one of the older rooms & it faced another apartment. Our AC made a lot of load noises, and the mattress took a little getting used to. The head of the bed was against the wall that separated us from the hallway. Each morning, we would hear all the noises of the hallway. The hotel did suggest we ask the manager to have our room changed, but we were settled with alot of groceries, so it would have been more bothersome to lug all of that stuff to another room. Housekeeping was horrible & inconsistent. The first day, we left $2 tip & our bed sheets were not changed, our dishes were not washed, nor was the place vacuumed. Thus the next day, we left $1 tip, but our sheets were changed, & our dishes were washed (no vacuuming though). The next couple of days, we were sick & stayed in, missing housekeeping. When we finally were well enough again to explore Hawaii, we left $3 tip (because the place was very messy), but no bed sheets were changed, no dishes were washed, kitchen garbage bin was untouched (with 2 days worth of old food in there), but somehow we got vacuuming. I was so disgusted with housekeeping @ this point. The only good thing about the hotel is the front desk staff. The friendliest, courteous, most helpful staff I've encountered, making the stay more acceptable. Good things about the location of the hotel 1) close to a breakfast place that served cheap breakfasts 2) close to the beach & international market place (yes do bargain with them) 3) an agent on site to arrange for tours etc 4) close to the food pantry market, but very expensive & not the freshest stuff i.e. purchased bagels & found them to be moldy (the staff @ the hotel can direct you to a local Walmart)

Reviews.Title: “A Hawaiian Gem”
Reviews.Author: BiLLYiZME
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Celebrity Waikiki confirmed the reviews I read on TripAdvisor. While the rooms are not of the same level as the new mega hotels, the rooms were pleasant, clean, and gigantic. Both smoking and non-smoking rooms are available. The Celebrity is convenient to shopping and dining. The inner courtyard and pool area are a refreshing oasis from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu. The front desk staff were, perhaps, the most pleasant and helpful staff I have ever encountered. The next time I am in Honolulu, I will be staying at the Celebrity Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and Cheap”
Reviews.Author: tmwli
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for inexpensive apartment-style accommodation with full kitchen facilities, this is a great option, just 2 short blocks from the infamous Waikiki beach. While there were certainly no celebrities staying at THIS hotel, we got a nice, very clean one bedroom apartment in this rather oddly named hotel for $119 per night. Very friendly, excellent tourist advisor on site, they even let you take their boards and inflatable pool toys down to the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Celebrity Resorts”
Reviews.Author: nhsuzanne
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotwire thinking that I was getting a different hotel. Hotwire has been inaccurate with 2 of my recent bookings. When referring to Tripadvisor ratings, which they do for some of their listings, they'll be off (by up to a month) as to when the last review was posted or how many points the listing has on Tripadvisor. Anyway, I was worried about this booking because the last review that had been posted at that time indicated a horrible stay. Lots of great reviews though, so in my review I'll just focus on what stood out to me. The hotel has a 2 1/2 star rating I believe, and I'd say this is fairly accurate. If the AC in the room wasn't running there was a mildewy smell. The AC was a little noisy so I had to sleep with earplugs every night but I am a sensitive sleeper. The room was spacious enough, had a nice little kitchenette, and we did get a room with a lanai overlooking the pool as I had requested. The staff were quite nice, and Aaron (sp?) at the front desk was exceptional. He was nice and funny, always in a great mood. I always read through all of the reviews on Tripadvisor before going to a hotel and I was disappointed that they no longer have Monday night hula dancing as some other reviewers had referred to. I asked about it at the front desk and the staff member said they had stopped the show months ago. They did still have Thursday morning pancakes but no pizza/cheescake on Thursday nights. Even though I booked this on Hotwire I later found other listings that were rated with more stars and were available for less money. I probably wouldn't stay at this hotel again, but I enjoyed my stay. If you like to do a lot of active and touristy things on your vacation I highly recommend purchasing the Go Oahu card (Google it) ahead of time. I bought a 5 day pass (we were there for a total of 7 days) and not only did we save a ton of money, but we got some great ideas for things to do.

Reviews.Title: “A Most Favorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: starrigaven
Reviews.Content: As a solo traveler I arrived on a late flight and was given a very nice unit on the third floor overlooking the garden and waterfall. I had two nights here, before moving onto another property, and wished my whole stay was here after the experience! I awoke to birds singing, and the sound of the waterfall, not of garbage trucks in the concrete jungle of Waikiki. It was so relaxing and enjoyable to start the morning with morning doves and songbirds. The hotel provides coffee in the morning around the pool, and everyone was congenial, and staff helpful. The unit itself was quiet, no real traffic noise, and being a small place I thought I would hear the neighbors. The walls are concrete and solid and provided a perfect sleep. Everything was provided for in the the little kitchenette, and the towels were nice and fluffy. The beach was a five minute walk straight through the fun International Market Place and I spent most of my days on the beach. In the late afternoon a nap on the lounger at the pool was perfect, falling asleep to gentle Hawaiian contemporary music. People were playing cards, sharing stories and engrossed in books around the pool in the last rays of the day. The sun does not filter in until midmorning to this property, so start your day with a brisk walk in the sun. Great water pressure in the shower, and completely clean throughout. This is a great little hotel for the money... and save by booking at their website.

Reviews.Title: “more than we expected”
Reviews.Author: nues
Reviews.Content: We were surprised that the hotel was so good. The room was spacious (not the cheapest room though) and clean. The kitchen and bathroom were in very good condition. We enjoyed being in a small hotel where we didn't have to go up and down lifts all the time, and where the staff were friendly and very helpful. Loved being able to walk out of the room and have breakfast sitting around the pool with a great cup of coffee provided. It was only five minutes to the beach through the International Markets (which did slow us down because we kept looking) and the bus stop was around the corner. Hint: catch the bus everywhere for $2 and don't waste your time and money on tours.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: shulin
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Celebrity Resorts this Christmas. I had read the reviews and was pleased that they were accurate (the positive ones) We're a family of 5 (two teenage boys and a 9 year old girl) the only challenge was when we first arrived (very late at night) there was no cot available for us. We made due by putting the couch cushions on the floor at night and creating a comfortable bed for our 13 year old. For the price it was worth it! As other reviews noted, the place was clean, spacious, location convenient and service fantastic and friendly. Our daughter loved the pool and meeting other kids. We didn't bother with a rental car as everything was accessible on foot or by bus. I have already recommended this resort to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: TravelWNC
Reviews.Content: If you don't like huge hotels, or want to save some money this IS the place. We called and made sure to reserve a room facing the pool, and got one. The staff was helpful, the rooms adequate, no smells or problems. The only suggestion I would make is to plan on making use of the kitchenette. It has everything you need, and there is a store just a block or so away. Also there are grills around the pool area that might as well be used.

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: Rorschachteacher
Reviews.Content: Little more than a motel with prices that match many of the big, beautiful hotels, this was the biggest disappointment of our trip. The rooms were small and smelled mildewy. The only positive was the staff who were friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little gem”
Reviews.Author: RangerEh
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in Waikiki for the first time, for 4 nights prior to going North Shore for a longer stay. The front desk staff at the Celebrity Resort was super friendly and warm, in a very genuine way; this was in fact the only place where I really felt aloha or ohana on this trip. The room was neither larger or smaller than other hotels, but was very efficiently laid out and clean; there was a very sweet and funny greeting left for us on the whiteboard by the room info. The courtyard is a real oasis of calm and peace in the hustle-bustle of Waikiki - it was a pleasure to hang out there. The location is excellent if you don't mind being off the beach - very close to the International Market and Duke's Lane, so the landmarks are great. Close to the buses, groceries and dining, and walking distance to just about everything in Waikiki. If I ever come back to Waikiki, I will definitely stay in this sweet little jewel tucked in amongst the behemoths!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise in Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: rubyskymom
Reviews.Content: This hotel/timeshare was a pleasant surprise in the hustle bustle of Waikiki. The location is very centralized and within walking distance of the beach and all of Waikiki. The manager and the rest of the Celebrity staff is very customer service oriented....which is always a breath of fresh air in this day and age of indifference. The room and bathroom were a bit dated but very clean.. Our kitchenette/ one bedroom suite was on the first floor facing the nicely landscaped pool area. The pool is small but quite pleasant. Parking is limited and if the hotel is full you will need to be put on a waitlist for parking your car on the grounds. There are no restaurants on site but you are close to a multitude of affordable dining places. "The Bus" bus stop is 3/4 of a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ray40
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Celebrity Resorts, and it will not be the last. Upon first entering the front desk area, we were made to feel right at home. Aaron was on duty, what a wonderful gentleman. Judy the Front Desk Manager runs a tight, and efficient operation. George the Facility Manager was very congenial, and friendly. The house keeping, and grounds keepers were busy, and kept the resort looking its 100%. The pool was nice, and the hot tub even nicer. Not too hot, but just right. The Thursday pancake breakfast was a real treat, it was our first day on the island, and gave us a chance to meet some of the other guests. The room was very comfortable, clean, with all the necessities of home. The kitchenette was most useful. The Resort is very close to the International Marketplace, and other restaurants are close by. The bus stop, along with the pickup point for our excursions was 3/4 of a block away. We will definitely stay again R Penrod Bakersfield CA

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: rdcummins
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in Honolulu before heading to a resort in Kauai. I needed a place that wasn't too expensive and not a dump. I was happy with this hotel. The rooms were a little small but the resort staff were very helpful and nice and the price was great. There is no elevator so getting to the 2nd floor with all our luggage was not convenient and they didn't have any bell boys to help. Otherwise, it was a pleasant stay. I wouldn't advise this for someone spending more than a few days unless you don't plan on being in the room much. The pool area was very nice and cozy. It is within walking distance of the beach as well as lots of street shopping. Good hotel for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Checked out early”
Reviews.Author: gail_wilson
Reviews.Content: I read all of these positive reviews and believe that we must have gotten one of the undesireable rooms. We booked this location for 4 nights on an RCI exchange. We stayed on the 3rd floor (Rm 306??). It was an efficiency unit. I must say that we were uncomfortable from the moment we checked into our room. We spent most of our time figuring out how not to spend any time in the room. First , the layout of the room: You open the door to the room. The headboard of the bed was right next to the door as you open it. About 3 steps later to the left is the bathoroom/closet. We came to be more horrified with this design when we actually utilized our bathroom. The bathroom has zero ventilation (if you get my drift)!!! No ventilation fan, no bathtub, just shower with shower curtain. Toilet is about 2 feet from the wet shower curtain. And your clothes share your bathroom space!! There is somewhat of a slatted door on the "closet". The other side of the room consisted of a sofa, kitchenette and balcony. There is air conditioniong. However, when you opened the balcony sliding door, the door bangs against the air conditioner. f you sit on the balcony, you get to listen to your and your neighbors' air conditioner. The kitchenette was nice, not in the bathroom. (Sorry, couldn't resist the humor). However the tightness of the room and the co-mingled space, literally makes you not want to deal with food in the room. The carpet was an old fashioned dark green color. It's ok when you first check-in, but as the hours go by, you notice that this color shows every grain of sand, every light colored speck, etc. Too tight of a space. Dated surroundings. Didn't feel that the room was clean. My husband misplaced his glasses. We still laugh at how horrified we were that they might have fallen under the bed. Neither of us wanted to check under or behind the bed. Luckily we found them before needing to do this. I'm sorry to say that we checked out of this hotel after 2 days. We're not hotel snobs. Our vacation just wasn't worth the hassle. I woke up both days thinking "How can I spend as little time in this room today, as possible?" Due to other positive reviews, which I relied on, my advice is to try get a "good" room. If that guarantee is not possible, I would not risk my vacation time being uncomfortable. Book something that you can be sure about. I didn't see any of the other rooms. On a positive note, the hotel staff very hospitable. Starbucks is close by. Galaxy Restaurant is also close by and has a great breakfast special ($2.99).

Reviews.Title: “Waikiki's best kept secret.”
Reviews.Author: NedPerth
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Celebrity Resorts on the way to and back from California. In our nine nights we managed to stay in a suite, a four person studio and two person studio. All the accomodation was excellent and considering what we paid, great value for money. The one bedroom suite was huge and would suit families as there is two bathrooms and more importantly two TVs! It also has a very good kitchen. The four person studio had a much larger bathroom than the two person one but both rooms were larger than an average hotel room and had a kitchenette which had all the pans, plates and utensils you could need. All the staff were very friendly and the location and condition of the hotel was great. In summing up we paid a lot more for hotels on our travels but none were as good as The Celebrity Resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: barbara1105
Reviews.Content: It was a low price for a Waikiki hotel, not too far from the beach, close to everything (shopping, public transport, etc.). The rooms were very nice, very clean. Friendly and helpful staff. I would definitely stay there again. We did have to walk up the stairs (3rd floor) but it was fine for us. But do keep it in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dwieg
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best kept secret in Hawaii. Not one of those high priced ritzy hotels with 40 floors. We went there for our 40th anniversary and loved every minute. So much, we booked for 7 nights and stayed for 11. Very helpful and friendly staff. Very clean and well maintained. Close to everything, but when lounging by the pool you never new you were. Honestly loved it and thank you Celebrity Resorts!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value in the middle of Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Celebrity Resorts for two days in July because it appeared to be the best value in the area near Duke’s Lane and the International Marketplace. We wanted to book a double room, but only a suite was available. The suite was worth the extra $20 a day, and it still cost less than a standard room at the Ilima Hotel next door. The hotel is served by a wireless Internet service called Wanderport that charges guests of this and other hotels $10 for 24 hours. It would have been a good deal if the service didn't get oversubscribed starting at about 9:30 a.m. The Internet unclogs again at night. Fortunately there is a good Internet cafe with reliable Internet access on Nahua Street, accessible through the back gate (room key can open the gate). We loved the round-the-clock availability of various kinds of coffee near the pool and the $3 all-you-can eat pancake and orange juice breakfast served every Thursday. Rooms were clean, and everything worked. The reception and cleaning staff were helpful, happy and friendly. We plan to stay there the next time we return to Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, No Frills in Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Melkolbe
Reviews.Content: This place was clean and cheap. Well situated in the middle of Waikiki. Not ocean view but you aren't paying for that. If you have to be in Oahu and in Waikiki, this would be a good bargain place to stay. The front desk staff are very nice, helpful and friendly. Even more friendly than some of the brass and glass places I've stayed in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Shhhh.... don't tell anyone! Keep it a secret!”
Reviews.Author: Canadiansonthego
Reviews.Content: Flying in from Australia, we were a little timid, not having stayed here before. We had booked Celebrity Resorts Waikiki based on the consistently good reviews from Trip Advisor. (Wondered if some of the Celebrity staff had submitted some of their own good comments(kidding!).) First the price was perfect for us holidaying on a budget but wanting to feel special anyway. Tears came to my eyes when we walked into our very large one bedroom suite. Spotlessly clean, very well appointed and with two bathrooms, two living areas, a small and neat kitchen, two TVs. Perfect for my partner and two children. Our glass sliding doors opened onto the courtyard pool area. Privacy for us all. Very lush tropical paradise. This little slice of heaven - only 3 floors tall - the little David amongst the skyscraper Goliaths. We didn't hear any traffic whatsoever. So, ok all of you reading this will appreciate the amenities and close proximity to the beach but hey... what about the customer service? More kudos for Judy (manager) and staff. Obviously they love people, take pride in their work and there are little extras that just delighted us. A range of free delicious flavoured coffees,each morning to choose from, an all-you-can-eat pancake and sausage breakfast on Thursday mornings and - yes - feel free to take the little beach chairs to the beach. There is a feeling of family and community here. We loved that. As we walked along Waikiki Beach at sunset, looking at the huge 5 star hotels, we felt like the lucky ones. Just one hesitation in writing this review - what if it becomes booked out and we can't get in next year? We will be very disappointed! Judy - if you read this, an extra thank you for your sincere graciousness and that of your delightful staff. 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Absoutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Hiswindow2heaven
Reviews.Content: This was my husbands first time to Hawaii and therefore, I really wanted to make it special. We were on a really tight budget and couldn't afford the luxury of a 5 star hotel. We were looking for something comfortable and affordable. I found Celebrity Resorts through Hotels.com and went on trip Advisor to see what reviews were written about the place. There were mostly positive reviews and I'd have to agree 100% with all of them. The bed was comforatable, the room was very clean and it came with a stove and fridge, so we were able to cook breakfast and dinner when we didn't have the money to eat out. It was literally less than a block away from the main street where all the shopping and restaurants were. It's a short bus ride down to the main mall. We also got tickets to "Germaine's Luau" and the pick up spot was a block away from the hotel. The staff was so friendly and accomodating. They answered all of our questions and when we needed more towels or directions..they were very prompt. We took advatange of the swimming pool and hot tub which were very clean and relaxing after a long day of walking and site seeing. They have these beautiful Palm Trees surrounding the pool area...makes you feel like you're swimming in the middle of a tropical forest. We absolutely loved our stay and will definitely return if we plan on visiting Honolulu again.

Reviews.Title: “It's only fair to share”
Reviews.Author: tak3
Reviews.Content: At the expense of perhaps not getting my requested exchange of RCI back to Celebrity Resorts Waikiki next year, it's only fair that I share this secret with readers of tripadvisor.com, as I have benefited from the generous contribution of others in the past. This is not a gold crown resort in RCI's books, but it's as good as one. Two strong points are: location and service. Long before I even set foot in the resort, I was impressed by the helpfulness of the staff. Judy ( front desk manager) and Marie were very patient with my questions, such as availability of wireless internet, rice cooker ( which was sitting on the dinner table when I first entered the room ) and arranging the same room as my RCI excahnge for those three add-on days, There is no surprise that one side of the building has better view than the other, and they were very nice in accomodating my request since it was made months in advance. During my stay, I met these two ladies plus Aaron and Joemar, who were all as pleasant and competent as previous posts ahd described. Aaron mentioned that he's been with the resort for only a few short years, and look forward to many more years of association. How often do you come across a front line worker saying that? It shows that these people are happy and take pride in their work. You just can't beat this location. I chose to use an internet cafe, and there's one just outside the back door, called Paradise Internet, on Nuhua St. It takes longer for me to get from my room to the front lobby of many big timeshare condos , such as Hilton Grand Vacation Club. For those who intend to do a fair bit of their own meal preparation, there's a decent grocery store two to three blocks away on Walina and Kuhio called the Food Pantry, which has most of what you need for a one week stay, and it's open almost all the time when I'm awake. Bus stops very conveniently located on Kuhio Ave half a block away. $20 for a visitor 4-day bus pass gets you virtually everywhere, so a car is really unnecessary unless you have a tight touring schedule and has little time to spare going from one site to another. The units have been renovated , as I noted new curtains and bedspreads. I tried hard to sniff but really cannot detect any trace of smoke. Wife is asthmatic and very sensitive to even the slightest hint of smoke. The unit itself is very clean, superior to that of Hilton grand Vacation Club. Last year, before I discovered Celebrity Resort, I stayed twice at the Ilima next door in a comparable one bedroom unit. It was nowhere as well kept, and 50% pricier. In 2007, we have stayed at Ritz-Carlton in Santiago, Four Seasons in Buenos Aires, Fairmont Banff Springs in Banff, Alberta, Chateau Lake Louise in Lake Louise, Alberta,( I have to add that the last three I got free upgrades to one bedroon suite, it's just been a lucky quarter of travelling) all arguably rated # 1 in their region, and yet I felt the most comfortable at Celebrity resort Wakiki. You bet I want to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: tbsparkles
Reviews.Content: We were really concerned what the resorts rooms were going to look like after viewing the website. We had 2 studio rooms, when viewing on the website it looked like the shower was in the kitchen. Needless to say they were not. Everyone at the resort was extremely kind and helpful. They would do everything they could to find answers to questions for you. Where to find I climbed Diamond Head tshirts, where was good places to eat. They were extremely good at directions. I just cant say enough nice things about the people that work at this resort. It really is close to so many things, must of the time we walked. There is a charge of 10.00 dollars a day to park at the resort, and is best to let them know ahead of time if you will be needing a space, because parking is very limited. The first night we had to park across the street at another resort and there it cost us 18.00 dollars. Cass and Theresa were very helpful in helping to plan tours, luas and day trips. We went to the Paradise Cove Lua at the suggestion of Cass and it was well worth the money. The food was great. We took a day trip over to Maui with Poylnesian Tours. We were picked up out in front of the resort and taken to the airport and then we flew to maui where we were met by a nother rep. The day was great. Our flight back was early. There was a rep there to great us and take us to the waiting tour bus. The wait on the tour bus and return trip to the hotel took longer than the flight. First we had to wait at least 30 minutes before we even started to leave the airport. Then the driver circled around and went back to the airport, picked up 1 passanger, then we left again, only to circle back again to the airport again. Where they loaded more passangers on, by this time was had been on the bus for over an hour. They had more passengers then seats, so then they had to make most of the ones they loaded get off. Finally we got on the road. The driver didn't act very knowledgble about where hotels were. He just stared hollarring out street names and asking if your hotel was close to that road. We ended up getting off about 2 blocks from our hotel and walking. Long story short I don't think i would go on another tour with this company

Reviews.Title: “Waikiki's best kept secret!”
Reviews.Author: Tandarook
Reviews.Content: At $68 per night we booked for this hotel with some trepidation telling ourselves even if it was a total dump we usually spend most of our time in Oahu out and about so it was worth a shot. What a wonderful suprise this hotel turned out to be! The ambience of the place is true Waikiki 60's style. From the minute you walk in the front door past the "Welcome Home sign" you know you are on to a winner. The lobby immeadiately transports you back in time with it's cane furniture, vintage Hawiian music and decor - all scrupulously clean. The staff are friendly and welcoming and the view to the pool screams Hawaii. Check in was a dream and we were in our room within minutes of arrival. The room was spacious and clean with all the amenitites you need to self service meals although with so many great eateries within walking distance who could be bothered! The maids did a great job of cleaning each day - including any dishes (which has not been our experience in other Oahu hotels in the area). One of the things I found interesting in previous TripAdvisor reviews stating the views were either great or terrible. This was easily explained once we arrived as half the rooms overlook the gorgeous coutyard with the pool, SPA and greenery and the other half overlook neighbouring alleys which are essentially the back of other shops and hotels. If you get the chance when booking definitely ask for a courtyard facing room. Ala the concierge was an absolute gem and arranged all our bookings in her friendly manner. It was lovely to meet her around the hotel over the next few days with her warm hello - she is a real asset to the hotel. It is worth checking the hotel price regularly in the days leading up to your stay as it varies depending on vacancy rate. We added on an extra night after we arrived and paid $89 for that night as it was close to the memorial day weekend. HIGHLIGHTS: a block to Waikiki beach, 2 minutes walk to Macy's, 1 minute walk to the International Market, bus stop on the corner, great pool, great SPA, lovely abience, scrupulously clean airconditioned rooms, friendly staff, car rental place literally across the street, CHEAP! DOWNSIDES: noise from a bar down the street (we were only woken twicxe in 8 nights so not as bad as it sounds), awful views if you have a room facing the alleys (ask for a courtyard facing room), musty smeall until we asked to have the airconditioner serviced then it was fine. Overall this hotel was fantastic and the best kept secret in Oahu. We will definitely be staying there again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrity Resorts Waikiki - a great choice!”
Reviews.Author: croatie
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place if you are doing Waikiki on a budget. Our group of 4 stayed in one of the "1 bedroom" suites. It was actually 2 rooms adjoined by a door. The only downfall is that one room has a queen bed and the other room has two pull-out sofa's. Since our travel companion was 4 months pregnant, she took the queen bed and my wife and I each took a couch as the pull-out was dreadfully painful. It was great having a kitchen to do our own cooking, and the two weber bbq's by the pool are top notch. It's not even two blocks away from the beach, and very close to restaurants, stores, transit, etc. As said before, the staff are FANTASTIC. Aaron and Judy were extremely helpful with everything. Since our flights didn't leave until 10:30pm, the let us store all of our luggage and even let us use a room to shower up after squeezing in one last visit to the beach. Oh, and the free coffee every morning was great. Grab some fresh baked croissants or danishes across the street at St. Germains Bakery and you've got a delicious and cheap breakfast on the go.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel and Service in Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: derf74
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Celebrity Resorts for a six day stay. We travel to Hawaii a lot and this was the best place we have stayed at ever. The staff is wonderful Words can not explain how wonderful they are. Living in Las Vegas NV and working with people all day, I was so empressed with Judy the manager who is terriffic and Arron the front desk clerk who is wonderful. I have never experienced such friendly staff every day. Everyone at this hotel , all staff get an A. The room are clean and the maid servic is terriffic. They have everything you would want in a resort. Close to the beach, market and even have coffee for free in the mornings. Pancake breakfest, pizza night etc. Don't miss out on this one!!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven On Earth”
Reviews.Author: bia592
Reviews.Content: Celebrity Resorts Hotel in Waikiki, is outstanding. I read all of the reviews on Expedia, and I thought that this Hotel should have been ranked much higher. There is no elevator, which to my husband and I was not a big deal what so ever, but the staff was outstanding, and very helpful. The housekeeping service came everyday, if you wanted, and cleaned everything. Even any dishes that might have been left in the sink. We stayed 4 nights, and that was not nearly enough. We will be going back to Hawaii in December of this year, 2007, and guess where we are staying, yep, you guessed it. Celebrity Resorts. In fact, we are going to talk to them about a time share.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome !”
Reviews.Author: lbd14
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful! The staff are exceptional ! Greg is the perfect host and the hotel staff were so helpful and so down to earth they made our stay The lobby was like old Hawaii and the pool was perfect with privacy from the busy streets. Central location to the beach and shopping! Activities are planned if you want to join in or not. I highly recommend joining in it was alot of fun! Kids loved it too and felt very safe in their surroundings. Rooms are very clean and comfortable! Loved it and would defineatly come back and stay with the folks who call you family while you are at your home away from home. Thankyou to all of you for making our family feel welcome !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Globetrekker0129
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on absolute last minute and I have to say we didn't get what we expected...in a good way. The room was HUGE (we got the suite, which is two rooms with a door in between) this room was way too big for just the two of us but it was still very nice and I couldn't believe what we got for the price, such a bargain. Everything was clean and tidy. About two blocks to Waikiki and lots of restaurants, shops and a nice little grocery store close by. We had a wonderful stay. On the last day checkout was at 11am and our plane didnt leave until the evening, they held our baggage and let us use a room that afternoon to shower in after a day at the beach, it was a great help and a lot more comfortable than showering at the beach! The only negative thing I would mention is make sure you reserve your parking if you rent a car. It is $10 a day if you park at the hotel BUT if they are out of spaces (there aren't very many!!) you get sent across the road to another hotel parking space where it is $18 a day!!! We booked this trip very last minute however, so lack of parking could mostly have been our fault, just make sure you've got a spot if you need one.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like Home”
Reviews.Author: andrealv
Reviews.Content: This was a small scale (3 story) hotel with not much of a view, but other than that, it was a great home away from home. The staff made you feel welcome, the location was just as great as any other hotel (close to everything) and their jacuzzi area is surrounded by plants and trees to make it very romantic. It appears to be a timeshare resort (signs mention guests and owners) and the guests we encountered usually seemed to be older couples. It was a nice quiet, comfortable place to stay with the little extras (like the kitchen) that make it a great deal for the price. It's not glamourous or fancy, but it has everything you need to relax after a day of swimming, sun or fun. They even have fun activities available on a daily basis, like a pizza party, scuba lessons, coconut painting, etc.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: melita06
Reviews.Content: PERFECT. My Boyfriend and I just returned from our first trip to oahu, and we stayed 5 nights in this hotel. It was the perfect choice. The staff is really nice, they help with all my questions. The studio room is perfect for 2 people. 1 bed, 1 sofa, a small kitchen with all you need, including microwave, toaster and blender. After 1 day we allready felt like we were home. Our plane was departing saturday night, and it was great that the hotel has a baggage room so after we chek out we left our things there and went all day to the beach, and when we got back they even lend us a shower and towels. I really recomend this hotel, it´s in the center of waikiki, 1 block from shoping (international market place, waikiki shoping center, royal hawaiian), half block from all the restaurants, 2 blocks from the beach, and half block from the bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem”
Reviews.Author: Benefits
Reviews.Content: Can't begin to explain how happy We were with our stay. This place is a hidden gem. Sure its not the four seasons, but for what we paid it certainly seemed like it. Stayed 4 nights in September over labor day weekend. Loved it. Right in the middle of everthing waikiki has to offer. Staff was great. Special thanks to Judy(manager), and Brian and Diana(front desk staff), they really made our stay pleasant. Nice grounds in the courtyard. Only negative I would say is the parking situation. It's tight. But thats waikiki. Since this was our first trip I now know that a car really isn't needed. Cab it and rent a car for maybe a day or two max. There are buses and trolleys everywhere but pretty much everthing can be reached on foot. I would definitely stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: White Sands Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 431 Nohonani St., Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96815 (Formerly Celebrity Resorts Waikiki)
